(AP) â€” A wildfire threatening a village in northern New Mexico has doubled in size to over 42 square miles (109 square kilometers) as firefighters try to protect nearly 300 homes and a Boy Scouts camp. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Fire management team spokeswoman Sandra Lopez said the fire on Saturday was about 3 miles (4.8 kilometers) west of Cimarron, which was evacuated Friday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The fire has destroyed 12 to 14 outbuildings at nearby Philmont Scout Ranch.
